title: One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
subhead: While Delcy Rodriguez, whom Donald Trump approved to replace Nicolas Maduro at the start of January, appears to be meeting Washington's expectations, it is still impossible to know whether this situation will open up space for democracy.

title: Trump warns Iran of 'bad things' unless deal struck with US
Clintons to testify in US House-led Epstein investigation
Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
subhead: As the international order recedes, the Canadian leader has moved on from the Trudeau era, when his predecessor was seen as naive on the world stage, in an effort to assert himself against hegemonic powers – starting with his American neighbor.

title: Workshops to 'love each other for the long haul': When the Church comes to the aid of couples
subhead: What if priests provided aftercare for marriage? Parishes and Catholic organizations in France are organizing gatherings for couples in difficulty, blending the word of God, practical advice and common sense.

title: 'Everyone knows I'm the most constipated girl in France': Young people open up about digestive troubles on social media
subhead: Stomach pain, dashing to the bathroom, bloating. For those under 30, talking openly about their digestion on TikTok, mixing self-deprecation with vulnerability, has become a way to reclaim control over their bodies.

title: Comic books: After Angoulême, a new French festival shows promise
subhead: After the International Comic Book Festival's 53rd edition was canceled, in Angoulême, southwestern France, the Grand Off and Interconnected Comic Book Festivals, conducted in around 15 European cities, kept the art alive.
byline: Adrien Le Gal,  Frédéric Potet and  Pauline Croquet

Najannguaq Hegelund, Greenland's tireless activist for the Inuit cause
subhead: This 37-year-old woman, deeply involved in the nonprofit sector and a supporter of independence for the Danish autonomous territory, has established herself as one of the leading figures in the protests against Donald Trump's expansionist ambitions.

title: An AI clone and a publicly traded company: The irresistible rise of TikToker Khaby Lame
subhead: The Senegalese-Italian influencer has sold his company for nearly $1 billion in a deal that includes the creation of a digital twin powered by artificial intelligence.

title: Frederik X, a monarch embraced by Greenlanders
subhead: Deeply attached to Greenland, where he once undertook a four-month expedition under extreme conditions, the king of Denmark is set to visit the island this month. Meanwhile, Donald Trump has not abandoned his ambition to claim it as American territory.

title: Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
